Description: Textile fragment of undyed linen and coloured wool tapestry: two black Africans, one naked, other with spear and leopard-skin kilt. Later sewn to a sheet of linen (a plain backing sheet is stored separately).
Technique: plain weave (main textile and plain linen sheet)
Curator's comments: Probably from a furnishing eg. a hanging such as BM43049. Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (1990)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2007 9 Mar-3 Sept, Belgium, Musee Royal de Mariemont, 'Pharaons noirs Sur la Piste des Quarante Jours'
